{{also|Morgen}} ==English== ===Etymology=== From {{bor|en|nl|morgen}} and {{bor|en|de|Morgen}}, both literally "morning", probably originally indicated the amount of land that can be ploughed by a team of oxen in a morning. ===Noun=== {{en-noun|morgen|morgens}} # {{lb|en|chiefly|historical}} A unit of measurement of land in the [[Netherlands]] and the Dutch colonies and parts of the [[United States]], where it was equivalent to about two [[acre]]s; and in [[Denmark]], [[Norway]], and [[Germany]], where it was equivalent to about two-thirds of an [[acre]]. Now used informally in Germany to mean one quarter of a [[hectare]]. {{defdate|from 17th c.}} #*{{quote-book|en|1969|{{w|Doris Lessing}}|The Four-Gated City|edition=1993|publisher=HarperCollins|page=68| |passage=‚ÄòAll my life spent hating a poor little tyrant on a few '''morgen''' of poor soil, and he'd never known anything else.‚Äô}} ===Further reading=== * {{pedia}} ===Anagrams=== * {{anagrams|en|a=egmnor|Monger|monger}} ---- ==Danish== ===Etymology=== From {{der|da|non|morginn}}, {{m|non|morgunn}}, from {{der|da|gem-pro|*murganaz}}, from {{der|da|ine-pro|*mrÃ•Hko||to blink, twinkle}}. Compare {{cog|nb|morgen}}, {{cog|sv|morgon}}, {{cog|is|morgunn}}, {{cog|en|morn}}, {{m|en|morrow}}, {{cog|nds|Morgen}}, {{cog|fy|moarn}}, {{cog|nl|morgen}}, {{cog|de|Morgen}}. ===Noun=== {{head|da|noun|g=c}} # [[morning]] (the part of the day after midnight and before midday) ---- ==Dutch== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|nl|dum|morgen}}, from {{inh|nl|odt|morgan}}, from {{inh|nl|gem-pro|*murganaz}}, from {{der|nl|ine-pro|*mrÃ•Hko||to blink, twinkle}}. Cognate with {{cog|osx|morgan}} ({{cog|nds|Morgen}} and {{m|nds|Morrn}} or {{m|nds|Morren}}), {{cog|fy|moarn}}, {{cog|nl|morgen}}, {{cog|goh|morgan}} ({{cog|de|Morgen}}), {{cog|non|morghon}} ({{cog|da|morgen}}, {{cog|sv|morgon}}), {{cog|non|morginn}}, {{m|non|morgunn}}; compare also (from a variant Germanic base) {{cog|non|myrginn}}, {{cog|got|êåºêå∞êåøêçÇêå≤êåπêåΩêçÉ}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|ang|/Ààmor…°en/|[Ààmor…£en]}} ===Noun=== {{ang-noun|m}} # [[morning|Morning]] #: {{ux|ang|G≈çdne '''morgen'''!|Good '''morning'''!}} #: {{ux|ang|on '''morgen'''|in the morning}} #: {{ux|ang|ƒ†iestran'''morgen''' iƒã ƒÅw≈çc of √æƒÅm seldsumestan swefne.|Yesterday '''morning''' I awoke from the strangest dream.}} # [[morrow|Morrow]], the [[next]] [[day]] #: {{ux|ang|t≈ç '''morgen'''|'''tomorrow'''}} ====Declension==== {{ang-decl-noun|morgen|[[morgnas]]|morgen|[[morgnas]]|[[morgnes]]|[[morgna, morgena]]|[[morgne]], [[morgen]], [[morge(n)ne]]|[[morgnum]]}} ====Synonyms==== * {{l|ang|morgend√¶g}} * {{sense|morning}} {{l|ang|morgenle≈çht}} ====Derived terms==== {{der-top}} * {{l|ang|«£rmorgen}} * {{l|ang|morgenceald}} * {{l|ang|morgencolla}} * {{l|ang|morgend√¶g}} * {{l|ang|morgendrenc}} * {{l|ang|morgengifu}} * {{l|ang|morgenlang}} * {{l|ang|morgenle≈çht}} * {{l|ang|morgenlƒ´c}} * {{l|ang|morgenmete}} {{der-mid}} * {{l|ang|morgenregn}} * {{l|ang|morgense≈çc}} * {{l|ang|morgenspell}} * {{l|ang|morgenspr«£c}} * {{l|ang|morgensteorra}} * {{l|ang|morgenswƒìg}} * {{l|ang|morgentƒ´d}} * {{l|ang|morgentorht}} * {{l|ang|morgenwacian}} {{der-bottom}} ====Descendants==== * {{desc|enm|morwen}}, {{l|enm|morwe}} ** {{desc|en|morn}}, {{l|en|morrow}} ** {{desc|sco|morn}} ===References=== * "[https://books.google.com/books?id=oXlii1KgDngC&pg=PA697 morgen]" in [https://books.google.com/books?id=oXlii1KgDngC&printsec=frontcover Bosworth & Toller's ''Anglo-Saxon Dictionary''] (1882), Oxford: Clarendon Press.
